techmeme.title: TSMC reports December revenue up 57.8% YoY to $8.4B, pushing the 2024 revenue to ~$88.02B, up 34% YoY, driven by AI chips demand from Nvidia and Broadcom (Nikkei Asia)
X says it is rolling out labels for parody or satire accounts to differentiate them from others and boost transparency; accounts have to apply for the labels (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Automattic plans to cut its WordPress contributions to 45 hours per week "due to the lawsuits from WP Engine", focusing mostly on security and critical updates (Automattic)
A hack of location data firm Gravy reveals Candy Crush, Tinder, and thousands of other apps are being used to steal user location data; apps may not even know (Joseph Cox/Wired)
Meta's new policies for contractors and staff moderating Facebook and Instagram allow dehumanizing speech, like "a trans person isn't a he or she, it's an it" (Casey Newton/Platformer)
